original_query: Looking for a 2-in-1 With Stylus Compatibility ($200 to 800 USD, US) Thank you in advance for any advice and suggestions LAPTOP QUESTIONNAIRE Total budget (in local currency) and country of purchase. Please do not use USD unless purchasing in the US: $200 to $800 US (possibly selling current laptop) Are you open to refurbs/used? Absolutely, almost preferred How would you prioritize form factor (ultrabook, 2-in-1, etc.), build quality, performance, and battery life? 2-in-1 or tablet+keyboard with stylus support and good battery life (7+ hrs, open to undervolting) How important is weight and thinness to you? Really only light enough to not collapse a music stand Do you have a preferred screen size? If indifferent, put N/A. Under 16in Are you doing any CAD/video editing/photo editing/gaming? List which programs/games you desire to run. Light gaming (Terraria is the heaviest I've played recently) If you're gaming, do you have certain games you want to play? At what settings and FPS do you want? Same as prev - 1080p 60, medium or higher settings Any specific requirements such as good keyboard, reliable build quality, touch-screen, finger-print reader, optical drive or good input devices (keyboard/touchpad) Stylus support (i.e. Surface pen, Galaxy sPen, etc.) Nub if Thinkpad USBC charging capable Leave any finishing thoughts here that you may feel are necessary and beneficial to the discussion. I am a college student, and I mostly use my laptop for homework, doc writing, and browsing. I also have a dreadfully slow tablet for note-taking and sheet music that I would like to replace. I bought my current laptop expecting to play heavy games or use CAD software often, but neither have happened in the year+ since I bought it. I may look to sell my current laptop ( for ~$750-800 hopefully, if I do sell) Asus Vivobook Pro 15 with Intel Ultra 7 and RTX 3050 I am reasonably software-savvy and open to experimenting and tinkering for things like battery life and power efficiency I use Linux Debian and Mint
shortened_query: Need a 2-in-1 or tablet+keyboard under $800 in the US with stylus compatibility and 7+ hours battery life. Prefer something under 16 inches, USB-C charging, and suitable for college work plus light gaming (e.g., Terraria at 1080p/60fps). Must work well with Linux (Debian/Mint) and open to refurb/used.

original_query: All-around Premium Ultrabook with Specific Requests Laptop Request US LAPTOP QUESTIONNAIRE Total budget (in local currency) and country of purchase. Please do not use USD unless purchasing in the US: $4000 USD Are you open to refurbs/used? No. How would you prioritize form factor (ultrabook, 2-in-1, etc.), build quality, performance, and battery life? My order of the above factors is: battery life, build quality, form factor (ultrabook), performance. All of these are secondary to my specific requirements expanded upon in the second to last question. How important is weight and thinness to you? Very important. Ideally, the laptop should be under 3lbs and less than 0.7 inches thick. Do you have a preferred screen size? If indifferent, put N/A. Prefer 14 inches or smaller. Can go up to 14.5 inches. Are you doing any CAD/video editing/photo editing/gaming? List which programs/games you desire to run. This laptop will be an all-arounder but the most intensive tasks would be compiling large codebases, running multiple docker containers and VMs, editing photos and videos (not professionally), and possibly large file copies for backups. If you're gaming, do you have certain games you want to play? At what settings and FPS do you want? N/A. The only game I play is OSRS and I'm sure I can do that on any laptop. Any specific requirements such as good keyboard, reliable build quality, touch-screen, finger-print reader, optical drive or good input devices (keyboard/touchpad)? Must haves: Intel CPU, 32GB RAM, 2x USB 4, 2x USB-A 3.2 Gen2, 2x m.2 NVMe slots (prefer 2280 but can live with one being 2230). Nice to haves (in order): SD card reader (micro or full), smart card reader, 64GB RAM, Ethernet, HDMI, aux, built-in webcam and microphone, fingerprint reader. Leave any finishing thoughts here that you may feel are necessary and beneficial to the discussion. I appreciate the help! I know something like this may not exist but figured I'd check to see if anyone knows of any unicorn laptops that I don't. I already have some options in mind which meet some but not all of my must haves so I'm really keenly focused on hearing from you all on things which would meet all of the must haves.
shortened_query: Looking for a premium ultrabook (preferably 14" or smaller) under $4000 with excellent battery life, build quality, and very low weight/thickness (under 3 lbs and under 0.7 inches). Must have an Intel CPU, 32GB RAM, 2x USB4, 2x USB-A 3.2 Gen2, and dual M.2 NVMe slots (2280 preferred; one 2230 acceptable). Intended for compiling large codebases, running multiple Docker containers/VMs, and casual photo/video editing.
compact_query: Intel ultrabook, 32GB RAM, dual M.2, USB4, 14-inch
extracted_criteria: {"price": 4000, "brand": null, "category": "office", "series": null, "attributes": {"cpu": "Intel", "ram_gb": 32, "storage_gb": null, "gpu": null, "screen_size": 14, "resolution": null, "refresh_rate_hz": null}, "good_for_gaming": "false", "good_for_ml": "false", "good_for_web_dev": "true", "good_for_creative": "true", "good_for_linux": "false"}

original_query: Need a laptop for college asap LAPTOP QUESTIONNAIRE Total budget (in local currency) and country of purchase. Please do not use USD unless purchasing in the US: $1400 USD, USA, the lower the better Are you open to refurbs/used? Yes, as long as there’s no damage and has original packaging. How would you prioritize form factor (ultrabook, 2-in-1, etc.), build quality, performance, and battery life? Good battery life and performance, then build quality, and would like 2-in-1 if possible. How important is weight and thinness to you? Not too important but will be lugging it around all day so lighter is better. Do you have a preferred screen size? If indifferent, put N/A. 14-15 inches. Are you doing any CAD/video editing/photo editing/gaming? List which programs/games you desire to run. I use solidworks, VS code, mySQL, and some light game design and art. Just starting off as a CIS major so not too sure what other software I would be using If you're gaming, do you have certain games you want to play? At what settings and FPS do you want? Forza Horizon 6, Hytale, modded minecraft. Would like to play at high but with the budget prob 60 fps at mid. Any specific requirements such as good keyboard, reliable build quality, touch-screen, finger-print reader, optical drive or good input devices (keyboard/touchpad)? Need touchscreen and OLED, would like good keyboard, touchpad, and a fingerprint reader. Leave any finishing thoughts here that you may feel are necessary and beneficial to the discussion. I know my wants are probably a pretty tall ask given the budget. I am looking at a Asus Zenbook S16 with the Ryzen AI 9 HX 370 since it’s on sale rn for $1399. It’s a 16in so not my first option. I’ve heard performance is good on them unfortunately it isn’t a 2-in-1 but I think it’s the best deal I’ve found so far. From what I’ve seen there are also issues with dissipating heat. Edit: Found a last gen Asus ProArt P16 with a 4070 for $1400. Thoughts on this?
shortened_query: Need a college laptop under $1400 in the USA (lower is better), preferably a lighter 14–15" 2-in-1 with good battery life and performance. Must have a touchscreen and OLED, and should handle SolidWorks, coding (VS Code/MySQL), light game design/art, and games like modded Minecraft/Forza around medium settings ~60 FPS. Considering ASUS Zenbook S16 (Ryzen AI 9 HX 370) or last-gen ASUS ProArt P16 with RTX 4070.
compact_query: under $1400, OLED touchscreen 2-in-1, 14-15 inch, SolidWorks + coding, light gaming
extracted_criteria: {"price": 1400, "brand": "Asus", "category": "creative", "series": null, "attributes": {"cpu": "Ryzen AI 9 HX 370", "ram_gb": null, "storage_gb": null, "gpu": "RTX 4070", "screen_size": 15, "resolution": null, "refresh_rate_hz": null}, "good_for_gaming": "true", "good_for_ml": "false", "good_for_web_dev": "true", "good_for_creative": "true", "good_for_linux": "false"}

original_query: /* Good laptop within 1000$ at Costco? Laptop Request US LAPTOP QUESTIONNAIRE Total budget (in local currency) and country of purchase. Please do not use USD unless purchasing in the US: Up to 1000$. Are you open to refurbs/used? No How would you prioritize form factor (ultrabook, 2-in-1, etc.), build quality, performance, and battery life? Battery life is important, I’d like to at least last a full day. How important is weight and thinness to you? Important. Looking for something that can be carried in a bag easily. Do you have a preferred screen size? If indifferent, put N/A. I like sizes close to the 13 inch MacBook airs Are you doing any CAD/video editing/photo editing/gaming? List which programs/games you desire to run. Light gaming, things like stardew valley and indie games. Eventually going to be using it for online classes. If you're gaming, do you have certain games you want to play? At what settings and FPS do you want? Light games such as Stardew valley, indie games, dating sims/visual novels. Any specific requirements such as good keyboard, reliable build quality, touch-screen, finger-print reader, optical drive or good input devices (keyboard/touchpad)? Reliable battery, can be touch screen. Leave any finishing thoughts here that you may feel are necessary and beneficial to the discussion. Mainly looking to purchase at Costco. No HP products, I’ve only seen bad things about them. The one I’ve seen the best things about is a MacBook Air m4 but my main concern is gaming and the availability of games on it.
shortened_query: Looking for a good laptop at Costco in the US for up to $1000, new only. Needs all-day battery life, lightweight/portable design, and a screen size around 13 inches. Will be used for online classes and light gaming (Stardew Valley, indie games); prefers not to buy HP and is considering a MacBook Air but worries about game availability.
compact_query: Costco under $1000, 13-inch, all-day battery, light gaming, no HP

original_query: /* Good laptop for DnD (Actually Lancer) Laptop Request US LAPTOP QUESTIONNAIRE Total budget (in local currency) and country of purchase. Please do not use USD unless purchasing in the US: Not more than $500 Are you open to refurbs/used? I am open to refurbished/used How would you prioritize form factor (ultrabook, 2-in-1, etc.), build quality, performance, and battery life? Able to run Foundry VTT with reccomended settings. Somewhat rugged is preferred but not required. How important is weight and thinness to you? Unimportant Do you have a preferred screen size? If indifferent, put N/A. 16 or more Are you doing any CAD/video editing/photo editing/gaming? List which programs/games you desire to run. Just needs to run Foundry VTT with reccomended settings. Any other requirements would be met by that as well. If you're gaming, do you have certain games you want to play? At what settings and FPS do you want? No gaming needed Any specific requirements such as good keyboard, reliable build quality, touch-screen, finger-print reader, optical drive or good input devices (keyboard/touchpad)? No specific requirements. Linux compatibility is preferred but by no means required. Leave any finishing thoughts here that you may feel are necessary and beneficial to the discussion. If any of you have experience running lancer on a laptop some specific reccomendations would be nice.
shortened_query: Looking for a laptop in the US under $500 (refurb/used is fine) that can run Foundry VTT at recommended settings for tabletop RPGs like Lancer. Prefers a 16-inch or larger screen and somewhat rugged build, but weight/thinness and extra features are not important. Linux compatibility is preferred but not required.

original_query: /* Considering Surface Pro for Aerospace Engineering Laptop Request US Second year AE student, currently using a 2023 macbook air and my girlfriend's old iPad Pro for taking notes in class. Looking to trade in my macbook for something to get me through the rest of school, and I would love it if it could run things like SolidWorks or other CAD software. Never intended to get sucked into the Apple sandbox and primarily use Windows/Android/Google ecosystems anyway. LAPTOP QUESTIONNAIRE Total budget (in local currency) and country of purchase. Please do not use USD unless purchasing in the US: ~$2k Are you open to refurbs/used? Yes How would you prioritize form factor (ultrabook, 2-in-1, etc.), build quality, performance, and battery life? Would prefer a 2-in-1 that can work with my home setup, that I can take to school. I have a monitor and keyboard that both connect via USB-C and a bluetooth mouse at home so I pretty much never use the laptop keyboard. All day battery life is nice but not a must, I typically have access to an outlet in at least one of my classes. How important is weight and thinness to you? Just needs to fit in my backpack and at a desk Do you have a preferred screen size? If indifferent, put N/A. Currently using an 11-inch iPad pro so anything larger would just be bonus. Are you doing any CAD/video editing/photo editing/gaming? List which programs/games you desire to run. Solidworks, MATLAB and other engineering programs eventually. Any specific requirements such as good keyboard, reliable build quality, touch-screen, finger-print reader, optical drive or good input devices (keyboard/touchpad)? Touch screen/note taking capabilities are important. Currently using OneNote for class.
shortened_query: US aerospace engineering student with ~$2000 budget wants a Windows-friendly 2-in-1 for school and home docking via USB-C. Needs touchscreen and pen/note-taking (OneNote) and enough performance for SolidWorks, MATLAB, and other engineering/CAD software. Open to refurbished/used; portability preferred but all-day battery is not required.
compact_query: 2-in-1, touchscreen+pen, SolidWorks, MATLAB, $2000
extracted_criteria: {"price": 2000, "brand": null, "category": "creative", "series": "Surface Pro", "attributes": {"cpu": null, "ram_gb": null, "storage_gb": null, "gpu": null, "screen_size": null, "resolution": null, "refresh_rate_hz": null}, "good_for_gaming": null, "good_for_ml": null, "good_for_web_dev": null, "good_for_creative": "true", "good_for_linux": null}

original_query: /* Looking for a laptop for school. Majoring in mechanical engineering. Laptop Request US LAPTOP QUESTIONNAIRE Total budget (in local currency) and country of purchase. Please do not use USD unless purchasing in the US: -2000$ Are you open to refurbs/used? -open box maybe but has to look new How would you prioritize form factor (ultrabook, 2-in-1, etc.), build quality, performance, and battery life? - Just a normal laptop, would like around 6 or more hours of battery life on normal use, not gaming. Probably have around 4 and half hours or so of class a day. Definitely need good performance. How important is weight and thinness to you? -I don’t want some big chungus, I want it to look like a normal ish laptop and be professional. Has to fit in a backpack and be comfortable to carry around. Do you have a preferred screen size? If indifferent, put N/A. -15-16 Are you doing any CAD/video editing/photo editing/gaming? List which programs/games you desire to run. -Fusion 360, Solidworks, blender, MATLAB, python etc. Beam.ng, Forza, gta. Any specific requirements such as good keyboard, reliable build quality, touch-screen, finger-print reader, optical drive or good input devices (keyboard/touchpad)? -Needs to type okay. I don’t really need a finger print or touch screen. I will probably be using an external mouse. Leave any finishing thoughts here that you may feel are necessary and beneficial to the discussion. - Here are a few laptops I was already looking at.
